byline.contributor: Kamil Kakol contributed reporting from Sulaimaniya, Iraq.

abstract: Islamic State moves to reassert itself by conducting its first offensive in northern Iraq in five months; Defense Sec Ashton B Carter, in region to assess and oversee American operations there, asserts Obama administration would keep its promise to deliver equipment to Kurdish forces fighting militant group.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State launched its largest attack in more than five months in a possible show of strength ahead of a visit by Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter.

headline.main: ISIS Carries Out First ‘Serious’ Attack in Northern Iraq in Months, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: ISIS Carries Out First ‘Serious’ Attack in Northern Iraq in Months, U.S. Says

snippet: The Islamic State launched its largest attack in more than five months in a possible show of strength ahead of a visit by Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
